body:
Elastos Carrier core APIs¶

Constants¶

ELA_MAX_ADDRESS_LEN¶

ELA_MAX_ADDRESS_LEN 52¶

Carrier User address max length.

ELA_MAX_ID_LEN¶

ELA_MAX_ID_LEN 45¶

Carrier Node/User ID max length.

ELA_MAX_USER_NAME_LEN¶

ELA_MAX_USER_NAME_LEN 63¶

Carrier user name max length.

ELA_MAX_USER_DESCRIPTION_LEN¶

ELA_MAX_USER_DESCRIPTION_LEN 127¶

Carrier user description max length.

ELA_MAX_PHONE_LEN¶

ELA_MAX_PHONE_LEN 31¶

Carrier user phone number max length.

ELA_MAX_EMAIL_LEN¶

ELA_MAX_EMAIL_LEN 127¶

Carrier user email address max length.

ELA_MAX_REGION_LEN¶

ELA_MAX_REGION_LEN 127¶

Carrier user region max length.

ELA_MAX_GENDER_LEN¶

ELA_MAX_GENDER_LEN 31¶

Carrier user gender max length.

ELA_MAX_NODE_NAME_LEN¶

ELA_MAX_NODE_NAME_LEN 63¶

Carrier node name max length.

ELA_MAX_NODE_DESCRIPTION_LEN¶

ELA_MAX_NODE_DESCRIPTION_LEN 127¶

Carrier node description max length.

ELA_MAX_APP_MESSAGE_LEN¶

ELA_MAX_APP_MESSAGE_LEN 1024¶

Carrier App message max length.

Data types¶

Bootstrap¶

struct BootstrapNode¶

Bootstrap defines a couple of perperities to provide for Carrier nodes to connect with.

The bootstrap nodes help Carrier nodes be connected to the others with more higher possibilities.

Public Members

const char *ipv4¶

The ip address supported with ipv4 protocol.

const char *ipv6¶

The ip address supported with ipv6 protocol.

const char *port¶

The ip port.

The default value is 33445.

const char *public_key¶

The unique public key to provide for Carrier nodes, terminated by null-string.

The length of public key is about 45 bytes.

ElaOptions¶

struct ElaOptions¶

ElaOptions defines several settings that control the way the Carrier node connects to others.

Remark
Default values are not defined for persistent_location of Carrier- Options, so application should be set persistent_location clearly. If the ElaOptions structure is defined as a static variable, initialization (in compliant compilers) sets all values to 0 (NULL for pointers).

Public Members

const char *persistent_location¶

The application defined persistent data location.

The location must be set.

bool udp_enabled¶

The option to decide to use udp transport or not.

Setting this option to false will force Carrier node to use TCP only, which will potentially slow down the message to run through.

ElaLogLevel log_level¶

Set the log level for Carrier logging output.

char *log_file¶

Set all logging messages from Carrier output to logfile.

Default is NULL, all the logging message will output to stdout.

void (*log_printer)(const char *format, va_list args)¶

Set a customized log printer, all logging messages from Carrier will also output to this printer.

Default is NULL.

size_t bootstraps_size¶

The total number of bootstrap nodes to connect.

There must have at least one bootstrap node for the very first time to create carrier instance.

BootstrapNode *bootstraps¶

The array of DHT bootstrap nodes.

size_t hive_bootstraps_size¶

The total number of Hive bootstrap nodes to connect.

There must have at least one bootstrap node for the very first time to create carrier instance.

HiveBootstrapNode *hive_bootstraps¶

The array of Hive bootstrap nodes.

ElaConnectionStatus¶

enum ElaConnectionStatus¶

Carrier node connection status to Carrier network.

Values:

ElaConnectionStatus_Connected¶

Carrier node connected to Carrier network.

Indicate the Carrier node is online.

ElaConnectionStatus_Disconnected¶

There is no connection to Carrier network.

Indicate the Carrier node is offline.

ElaPresenceStatus¶

enum ElaPresenceStatus¶

Carrier node presence status to Carrier network.

Values:

ElaPresenceStatus_None¶

Carrier node is online and available.

ElaPresenceStatus_Away¶

Carrier node is being away.

Carrier node can set this value with an user defined inactivity time.

ElaPresenceStatus_Busy¶

Carrier node is being busy.

Carrier node can set this value to tell friends that it can not currently wish to commincate.

ElaLogLevel¶

enum ElaLogLevel¶

Carrier log level to control or filter log output.

Values:

ElaLogLevel_None = 0¶

Log level None Indicate disable log output.

ElaLogLevel_Fatal = 1¶

Log level fatal.

Indicate output log with level ‘Fatal’ only.

ElaLogLevel_Error = 2¶

Log level error.

Indicate output log above ‘Error’ level.

ElaLogLevel_Warning = 3¶

Log level warning.

Indicate output log above ‘Warning’ level.

ElaLogLevel_Info = 4¶

Log level info.

Indicate output log above ‘Info’ level.

ElaLogLevel_Debug = 5¶
ElaLogLevel_Trace = 6¶
ElaLogLevel_Verbose = 7¶

ElaUserInfo¶

struct ElaUserInfo¶

A structure representing the Carrier user information.

In Carrier SDK, self and all friends are carrier user, and have same user attributes.

Public Members

char userid[ELA_MAX_ID_LEN + 1]¶

User ID.

Read only to application.

char name[ELA_MAX_USER_NAME_LEN + 1]¶

Nickname, also known as display name.

char description[ELA_MAX_USER_DESCRIPTION_LEN + 1]¶

User’s description, also known as what’s up.

int has_avatar¶

If user has an avatar.

char gender[ELA_MAX_GENDER_LEN + 1]¶

User’s gender.

char phone[ELA_MAX_PHONE_LEN + 1]¶

User’s phone number.

char email[ELA_MAX_EMAIL_LEN + 1]¶

User’s email address.

char region[ELA_MAX_REGION_LEN + 1]¶

User’s region information.

ElaFriendInfo¶

struct ElaFriendInfo¶

A structure representing the Carrier friend information.

Include the basic user information and the extra friend information.

Public Members

ElaUserInfo user_info¶

Friend’s user information.

char label[ELA_MAX_USER_NAME_LEN + 1]¶

Your label for the friend.

ElaConnectionStatus status¶

Friend’s connection status.

ElaPresenceStatus presence¶

Friend’s presence status.

ElaCallbacks¶

struct ElaCallbacks¶

Carrier callbacks, include all global callbacks for Carrier.

Public Members

void (*idle)(ElaCarrier *carrier, void *context)¶

An application-defined function that perform idle work.

Parameters
  • carrier: [in] A handle to the Carrier node instance.
  • context: [in] The application defined context data.

void (*connection_status)(ElaCarrier *carrier, ElaConnectionStatus status, void *context)¶

An application-defined function that process the self connection status.

See
ElaConnectionStatus.
Parameters
  • carrier: [in] A handle to the Carrier node instance.
  • status: [in] Current connection status.
Parameters
  • context: [in] The application defined context data.

void (*ready)(ElaCarrier *carrier, void *context)¶

An application-defined function that process the ready notification.

Notice: application should wait this callback invoked before calling any carrier function to interact with friends.

Parameters
  • carrier: [in] A handle to the Carrier node instance.
  • context: [in] The application defined context data.

void (*self_info)(ElaCarrier *carrier, const ElaUserInfo *info, void *context)¶

An application-defined function that process the self info change event.

This callback is reserved for future compatibility.

Parameters
  • carrier: [in] A handle to the Carrier node instance.
  • info: [in] The ElaUserInfo pointer to the new user info.
  • context: [in] The application defined context data.

bool (*friend_list)(ElaCarrier *carrier, const ElaFriendInfo *info, void *context)¶

An application-defined function that iterate the each friends list item.

Return
Return true to continue iterate next friend user info, false to stop iterate.
Parameters
  • carrier: [in] A handle to the Carrier node instance.
  • info: [in] A pointer to ElaFriendInfo structure that representing a friend(NULL indicates iteration finished).
  • context: [in] The application defined context data.

void (*friend_connection)(ElaCarrier *carrier, const char *friendid, ElaConnectionStatus status, void *context)¶

An application-defined function that process the friend connection change event.

See
ElaConnectionStatus
Parameters
  • carrier: [in] A handle to the Carrier node instance.
  • friendid: [in] The friend’s user id.
  • status: [in] Connection status.
Parameters
  • context: [in] The application defined context data.

void (*friend_info)(ElaCarrier *carrier, const char *friendid, const ElaFriendInfo *info, void *context)¶

An application-defined function that process the friend information change event.

Parameters
  • carrier: [in] A handle to the Carrier node instance.
  • friendid: [in] The friend’s user id.
  • info: [in] The ElaFriendInfo pointer to the new friend info.
  • context: [in] The application defined context data.

void (*friend_presence)(ElaCarrier *carrier, const char *friendid, ElaPresenceStatus presence, void *context)¶

An application-defined function that process the friend presence change event.

Parameters
  • carrier: [in] A handle to the Carrier node instance.
  • friendid: [in] The friend’s user id.
  • presence: [in] The presence status of the friend.
  • context: [in] The application defined context data.

void (*friend_request)(ElaCarrier *carrier, const char *userid, const ElaUserInfo *info, const char *hello, void *context)¶

An application-defined function that process the friend request.

Parameters
  • carrier: [in] A handle to the Carrier node instance.
  • userid: [in] The user id who wants friend with us.
  • info: [in] The basic user info who wants to be friend.
  • hello: [in] PIN for target user, or any application defined content.
  • context: [in] The application defined context data.

void (*friend_added)(ElaCarrier *carrier, const ElaFriendInfo *info, void *context)¶

An application-defined function that process the new friend added event.

Parameters
  • carrier: [in] A handle to the Carrier node instance.
  • info: [in] The firend’s information.
  • context: [in] The application defined context data.

void (*friend_removed)(ElaCarrier *carrier, const char *friendid, void *context)¶

An application-defined function that process the friend removed event.

Parameters
  • carrier: [in] A handle to the Carrier node instance.
  • friendid: [in] The friend’s user id.
  • context: [in] The application defined context data.

void (*friend_message)(ElaCarrier *carrier, const char *from, const void *msg, size_t len, void *context)¶

An application-defined function that process the friend messages.

Parameters
  • carrier: [in] A handle to the Carrier node instance.
  • from: [in] The user id from who send the message.
  • msg: [in] The message content.
  • len: [in] The message length in bytes.
  • context: [in] The application defined context data.

void (*friend_invite)(ElaCarrier *carrier, const char *from, const char *bundle, const void *data, size_t len, void *context)¶

An application-defined function that process the friend invite request.

Parameters
  • carrier: [in] A handle to the Carrier node instance.
  • from: [in] The user id from who send the invite request.
  • bundle: [in] The bundle attached to this invite request.
  • data: [in] The application defined data send from friend.
  • len: [in] The data length in bytes.
  • context: [in] The application defined context data.

void (*group_invite)(ElaCarrier *w, const char *from, const void *cookie, size_t len, void *context)¶

An application-defined function that process the group invite request.

Parameters
  • carrier: [in] A handle to the Carrier node instance.
  • from: [in] The user id from who send the invite request.
  • cookie: [in] The application defined cookie send from friend.
  • len: [in] The data length in bytes.
  • context: [in] The application defined context data.

ElaGroupCallbacks group_callbacks¶

Group related callbacks.

ElaFriendsIterateCallback¶

typedef bool ElaFriendsIterateCallback(const ElaFriendInfo *info, void *context)¶

An application-defined function that iterate the each friends list item.

ElaFriendsIterateCallback is the callback function type.

Return
Return true to continue iterate next friend user info, false to stop iterate.
Parameters
  • info: [in] A pointer to ElaFriendInfo structure that representing a friend(NULL indicates iteration finished).
  • context: [in] The application defined context data.

ElaFriendInviteResponseCallback¶

typedef void ElaFriendInviteResponseCallback(ElaCarrier *carrier, const char *from, const char *bundle, int status, const char *reason, const void *data, size_t len, void *context)¶

An application-defined function that process the friend invite response.

CarrierFriendInviteResponseCallback is the callback function type.

Parameters
  • carrier: [in] A handle to the Carrier node instance.
  • from: [in] The target user id.
  • bundle: [in] The bundle attached to this invite reply.
  • status: [in] The status code of the response. 0 is success, otherwise is error.
  • reason: [in] The error message if status is error, or NULL
  • data: [in] The application defined data return by target user.
  • len: [in] The data length in bytes.
  • context: [in] The application defined context data.

Functions¶

Carrier instance¶

ela_new¶

ElaCarrier *ela_new(const ElaOptions *options, ElaCallbacks *callbacks, void *context)¶

Create a new Carrier node instance.

after creating the instance, it’s ready for connection to Carrier network.

Return
If no error occurs, return the pointer of Carrier node instance. Otherwise, return NULL, and a specific error code can be retrieved by calling ela_get_error().
Parameters
  • options: [in] A pointer to a valid ElaOptions structure.
  • callbacks: [in] The Application defined callback functions.
  • context: [in] The application defined context data.

ela_run¶

int ela_run(ElaCarrier *carrier, int interval)¶

Attempts to connect the node to Carrier network.

If the node successfully connects to Carrier network, then it starts the node’s main event loop. The connect options was specified by previously create options.

See
ela_new().
Return
0 if the client successfully connected to Carrier network and start the event loop. Otherwise, return -1, and a specific error code can be retrieved by calling ela_get_error().
Parameters
  • carrier: [in] A handle identifying the Carrier node instance.
  • interval: [in] Internal loop interval, in milliseconds.

ela_kill¶

void ela_kill(ElaCarrier *carrier)¶

Disconnect from Carrier network, and destroy all associated resources with the Carrier node instance.

After calling the function, the Carrier pointer becomes invalid. No other functions can be called.

Parameters
  • carrier: [in] A handle identifying the Carrier node instance to kill.

ela_is_ready¶

bool ela_is_ready(ElaCarrier *carrier)¶

Check if Carrier node instance is being ready.

All carrier interactive APIs should be called only if carrier instance is being ready.

Return
true if the carrier node instance is ready, or false if not.
Parameters
  • carrier: [in] A handle to the Carrier node instance.

Node Information¶

ela_get_address¶

char *ela_get_address(ElaCarrier *carrier, char *address, size_t len)¶

Get user address associated with the Carrier node.

Return
The address string pointer, or NULL if buffer is too small.
Parameters
  • carrier: [in] A handle to the Carrier node instance.
  • address: [out] The buffer that will receive the address. The buffer size should at least (ELA_MAX_ADDRESS_LEN + 1) bytes.
  • len: [in] The buffer size of address.

ela_get_nodeid¶

char *ela_get_nodeid(ElaCarrier *carrier, char *nodeid, size_t len)¶

Get node identifier associated with this Carrier node.

Return
The nodeId string pointer, or NULL if buffer is too small.
Parameters
  • carrier: [in] A handle to the Carrier node instance.
  • nodeid: [out] The buffer that will receive the identifier. The buffer size should at least (ELA_MAX_ID_LEN + 1) bytes.
  • len: [in] The buffer size of nodeid.

ela_get_userid¶

char *ela_get_userid(ElaCarrier *carrier, char *userid, size_t len)¶

Get user identifier associated with this Carrier node.

Return
The userId string pointer, or NULL if buffer is too small.
Parameters
  • carrier: [in] A handle to the Carrier node instance.
  • userid: [out] The buffer that will receive the identifier. The buffer size should at least (ELA_MAX_ID_LEN + 1) bytes.
  • len: [in] The buffer size of userid.

ela_get_id_by_address¶

char *ela_get_id_by_address(const char *address, char *userid, size_t len)¶

Extract carrier userid (or nodeid) from the carrier address.

Return
If no error occurs, return the pointer of extraced userid. Otherwise, return NULL, and a specific error code can be retrieved by calling ela_get_error().
Parameters
  • address: [in] the carrier address to be check.
  • userid: [in] the buffer to save the extracted userid.
  • len: [in] the length of buffer.

ela_set_self_nospam¶

int ela_set_self_nospam(ElaCarrier *carrier, uint32_t nospam)¶

ela_get_self_nospam¶

int ela_get_self_nospam(ElaCarrier *carrier, uint32_t *nospam)¶

ela_set_self_info¶

int ela_set_self_info(ElaCarrier *carrier, const ElaUserInfo *info)¶

Update self information.

As self information changed, Carrier node would update itself information to Carrier network, which would forward the change to all friends. nodes.

Return
0 on success, or -1 if an error occurred. The specific error code can be retrieved by calling ela_get_error().
Parameters
  • carrier: [in] A handle to the Carrier node instance.
  • info: [in] The ElaUserInfo pointer to the updated user info.

ela_get_self_info¶

int ela_get_self_info(ElaCarrier *carrier, ElaUserInfo *info)¶

Get self information.

Return
0 on success, or -1 if an error occurred. The specific error code can be retrieved by calling ela_get_error().
Parameters
  • carrier: [in] A handle to the Carrier node instance.
  • info: [in] The ElaUserInfo pointer to receive user info.

ela_set_self_presence¶

int ela_set_self_presence(ElaCarrier *carrier, ElaPresenceStatus presence)¶

Set self presence status.

Return
0 on success, or -1 if an error occurred. The specific error code can be retrieved by calling ela_get_error().
Parameters
  • carrier: [in] A handle to the Carrier node instance.
  • presence: [in] the new presence status.

ela_get_self_presence¶

int ela_get_self_presence(ElaCarrier *carrier, ElaPresenceStatus *presence)¶

Get self presence status.

Return
0 on success, or -1 if an error occurred. The specific error code can be retrieved by calling ela_get_error().
Parameters
  • carrier: [in] A handle to the Carrier node instance.
  • presence: [in] A pointer to receive presence status value.

Friend & interaction¶

ela_get_friends¶

int ela_get_friends(ElaCarrier *carrier, ElaFriendsIterateCallback *callback, void *context)¶

Get friends list.

For each friend will call the application defined iterate callback.

Return
0 on success, or -1 if an error occurred. The specific error code can be retrieved by calling ela_get_error().
Parameters
  • carrier: [in] a handle to the Carrier node instance.
  • callback: [in] a pointer to ElaFriendsIterateCallback function.
  • context: [in] the application defined context data.

ela_get_friend_info¶

int ela_get_friend_info(ElaCarrier *carrier, const char *friendid, ElaFriendInfo *info)¶

Get friend information.

Return
0 on success, or -1 if an error occurred. The specific error code can be retrieved by calling ela_get_error().
Parameters
  • carrier: [in] A handle to the Carrier node instance.
  • friendid: [in] The friend’s user id.
  • info: [in] The ElaFriendInfo pointer to receive the friend information.

ela_set_friend_label¶

int ela_set_friend_label(ElaCarrier *carrier, const char *friendid, const char *label)¶

Set the label of the specified friend.

If the value length is 0 or value is NULL, the attribute will be cleared.

Return
0 on success, or -1 if an error occurred. The specific error code can be retrieved by calling ela_get_error().
Remark
The label of a friend is a private alias named by yourself. It can be seen by yourself only, and has no impact to the target friend.
Parameters
  • carrier: [in] A handle to the Carrier node instance.
  • friendid: [in] The friend’s user id.
  • label: [in] the new label of the specified friend.

ela_is_friend¶

bool ela_is_friend(ElaCarrier *carrier, const char *userid)¶

Check if the user ID is friend.

Return
true if the user id is friend, or false if not;
Parameters
  • carrier: [in] A handle to the Carrier node instance.
  • userid: [in] The userid to check.

ela_add_friend¶

int ela_add_friend(ElaCarrier *carrier, const char *address, const char *hello)¶

Attempt to add friend by sending a new friend request.

This function will add a new friend with specific address, and then send a friend request to the target node.

Return
0 if adding friend is successful. Otherwise, return -1, and a specific error code can be retrieved by calling ela_get_error().
Parameters
  • carrier: [in] A handle to the Carrier node instance.
  • address: [in] The target user address.
  • hello: [in] PIN for target user, or any application defined content.

ela_accept_friend¶

int ela_accept_friend(ElaCarrier *carrier, const char *userid)¶

Accept the friend request.

This function is used to add a friend in response to a friend request.

Return
0 if adding friend successfully. Otherwise, return -1, and a specific error code can be retrieved by calling ela_get_error().
Parameters
  • carrier: [in] A handle to the Carrier node instance.
  • userid: [in] The user id to who wants to be friend with us.

ela_remove_friend¶

int ela_remove_friend(ElaCarrier *carrier, const char *userid)¶

Remove a friend.

This function will send a remove friend indicator to Carrier network.

If all correct, Carrier network will clean the friend relationship, and send friend removed message to both.

Return
0 if the indicator successfully sent. Otherwise, return -1, and a specific error code can be retrieved by calling ela_get_error().
Parameters
  • carrier: [in] A handle to the Carrier node instance.
  • userid: [in] The target user id.

ela_send_friend_message¶

int ela_send_friend_message(ElaCarrier *carrier, const char *to, const void *msg, size_t len)¶

Send a message to a friend.

The message length may not exceed ELA_MAX_APP_MESSAGE_LEN. Larger messages must be split by application and sent as separate fragments. Other carrier nodes can reassemble the fragments.

Message may not be empty or NULL.

Return
0 if the text message successfully sent. Otherwise, return -1, and a specific error code can be retrieved by calling ela_get_error().
Parameters
  • carrier: [in] A handle to the Carrier node instance.
  • to: [in] The target userid.
  • msg: [in] The message content defined by application.
  • len: [in] The message length in bytes.

ela_invite_friend¶

int ela_invite_friend(ElaCarrier *carrier, const char *to, const char *bundle, const void *data, size_t len, ElaFriendInviteResponseCallback *callback, void *context)¶

Send invite request to a friend.

Application can attach the application defined data within the invite request, and the data will send to target friend.

Return
0 if the invite request successfully send to the friend. Otherwise, return -1, and a specific error code can be retrieved by calling ela_get_error().
Parameters
  • carrier: [in] A handle to the Carrier node instance.
  • to: [in] The target userid.
  • bundle: [in] The bundle attached to this invitation.
  • data: [in] The application defined data send to target user.
  • len: [in] The data length in bytes.
  • callback: [in] A pointer to ElaFriendInviteResponseCallback function to receive the invite response.
  • context: [in] The application defined context data.

ela_reply_friend_invite¶

int ela_reply_friend_invite(ElaCarrier *carrier, const char *to, const char *bundle, int status, const char *reason, const void *data, size_t len)¶

Reply the friend invite request.

This function will send a invite response to friend.

Return
0 if the invite response successfully send to the friend. Otherwise, return -1, and a specific error code can be retrieved by calling ela_get_error().
Parameters
  • carrier: [in] A handle to the Carrier node instance.
  • to: [in] The userid who send invite request.
  • bundle: [in] The bundle attached to this invitation reply.
  • status: [in] The status code of the response. 0 is success, otherwise is error.
  • reason: [in] The error message if status is error, or NULL if success.
  • data: [in] The application defined data send to target user. If the status is error, this will be ignored.
  • len: [in] The data length in bytes. If the status is error, this will be ignored.

Utility functions¶

ela_get_version¶

const char *ela_get_version(void)¶

Get the current version of Carrier node.

ela_log_init¶

void ela_log_init(ElaLogLevel level, const char *log_file, void (*log_printer)(const char *format, va_list args))¶

initialize log options for Carrier.

The default level to control log output is ‘Info’.

Parameters
  • level: [in] The log level to control internal log output.
  • log_file: [in] the log file name. If the log_file is NULL, Carrier will not write log to file.
  • log_printer: [in] the user defined log printer. can be NULL.

ela_address_is_valid¶

bool ela_address_is_valid(const char *address)¶

Check if the carrier address is valid.

Return
true if address is valid, or false if address is not valid.
Parameters
  • address: [in] the carrier address to be check.

ela_id_is_valid¶

bool ela_id_is_valid(const char *id)¶

Check if the carrier ID is valid.

Return
true if id is valid, or false if id is not valid.
Parameters
  • id: [in] the carrier id to be check.

ela_get_error¶

int ela_get_error(void)¶

ela_clear_error¶

void ela_clear_error(void)¶

Clear the last-error code of a Carrier instance.
